model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Parent, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker B: Awesome! Tomorrow afternoon anytime between 3-6 would work for me!

[MEMORY]
1. Speaker B signed up for classes at the local college and has a background in football and karate.
2. Speaker B practices Karate and holds a green belt, being involved in other activities and considering going back to school for a certificate in IT work.
3. Speaker B attends football games at their old high school and finds that their football background helps in karate footwork.
4. Speaker A and Speaker B both have interests in learning new languages.
5. Speaker B enjoys water-related activities and movies like "Jaws".
6. Speaker A is taking a French class and plans to learn French to dig for clams in Quebec.
current_dialogue: Speaker B: Awesome! Tomorrow afternoon anytime between 3-6 would work for me!
